Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of large Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of warrior to left, wearing short chiton (with added red dots and border of incised chevrons between double lines) and red greaves, and holding a shield (red rim, uncertain device in added white); at right, part of woman facing left with white arms extended, wearing long peplos (red with black vertical stripe chevron border at bottom of overfall).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.35)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 444, no. B731)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0516) (Phase 1)
